nodes.bodyText:
Use the specified .Values.master.hostNetwork if specified, otherwise infer based on whether the user is root.
FYI for boolean values the {{ .Values.master.hostNetwork | default $isRoot}} grammar doesn't work, because a false value for .Values.master.hostNetwork will also go to the default branch.
I don't think we still want to consider emptyDir, do we?
This field is obsoleted. Removing it is irrelevant to the change.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -73,15 +73,13 @@ master:
   # JVM options specific to the master container
   jvmOptions:
   nodeSelector: {}
-  hostNetwork: false
-  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst
   # Example: use ROCKS DB instead of Heap
   # metastore:
   #   size: 1Gi
-  #   mountPath: /metastore

nodes.bodyText: Removed these two by default and use inference. However they can still be set to override, especially when we want to use some dnsPolicy other than ClusterFirst and ClusterFirstWithHostNet
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -73,15 +73,13 @@ master:
   # JVM options specific to the master container
   jvmOptions:
   nodeSelector: {}
-  hostNetwork: false
-  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst

nodes.bodyText: instead of removing this, i would comment it out and explain the order of precedence
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -73,15 +73,13 @@ master:
   # JVM options specific to the master container
   jvmOptions:
   nodeSelector: {}
-  hostNetwork: false
-  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst

@@ -73,15 +73,13 @@ master:
   # JVM options specific to the master container
   jvmOptions:
   nodeSelector: {}
-  hostNetwork: false
-  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst

nodes.bodyText: add comment defining when this property is used
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -119,6 +117,7 @@ journal:
   type: "UFS" # "UFS" or "EMBEDDED"
   ufsType: "local" # Ignored if type is "EMBEDDED". "local" or "HDFS"
   folder: "/journal" # Master journal folder
+  hostPath: "/tmp/journal"

@@ -229,6 +226,7 @@ shortCircuit:
     - ReadWriteOnce
   pvcSize: 1Mi
   pvcStorageClass: standard
+  hostPath: "/tmp/alluxio-domain"

nodes.bodyText: @madanadit I realized during testing that using hostPath is really hard when we deploy as StatefulSet, as each master should be using different paths. Current w/o internal logic in Alluxio (for example write to <journal-path>/<master-id>/ when given the journal path) I don't think it will work. Currently in a non-k8s env, we don't really support deploying multiple masters on one machine right?
yep, multiple masters on the same host is not a scenario we plan to support
